content: The license limit counter consists of: already existing accounts in {{productName}} and new users that you want to import. If you import users who already have a {{productName}} account, they will not be counted again in the counter. Your {{productName}} license allows you to have a maximum of {{maxLimit}} users.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a descriptive message about the license limit counter in the Portal Settings page. It explains that the limit applies to existing accounts and new users being imported, without counting duplicate users. The text appears as a tooltip when clicking the "Help" button on this page.

usage.context:
<HelpButton
 place="right"
 offsetRight={0}
 tooltipContent={
 <Text fontSize="12px">
 {t("Settings:LicenseLimitDescription", {
 productName: t("Common:ProductName"),
 maxLimit: quota.max,
 })}
 </Text>
 }

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "يتكون عداد حد الترخيص من" is a bit awkward. A more natural phrasing would be something like "يُحسب حد الترخيص بناءً على" or "يعتمد حد الترخيص على".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: يُحسب حد الترخيص بناءً على

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "المستخدمين الجدد الذين تريد استيرادهم" is technically correct but sounds a little verbose. A more concise option would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: المستخدمين الجدد الذين ترغب باستيرادهم

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "فلن يتم احتسابهم مرة أخرى في العداد" could be more elegantly phrased.  A more fluent translation would emphasize that they won't increase the limit.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: لن يضافوا إلى الحد الأقصى.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "already existing accounts" is translated as "mövcud hesablar". While technically correct, a more natural and common phrasing in Azerbaijani would be something like "var olan hesablar" or "mövcud olan hesablar".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Lisenziya limiti sayğacı aşağıdakılardan ibarətdir: {{productName}}-də var olan hesablar və idxal etmək istədiyiniz yeni istifadəçilər.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "they will not be counted again in the counter" is translated somewhat literally. A more natural phrasing would convey the idea that they won't be double-counted.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Artıq {{productName}} hesabı olan istifadəçiləri idxal etsəniz, onlar sayğacda iki dəfə sayılmayacaqlar.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, a more common Azerbaijani sentence structure would place the possessive pronoun after the noun, similar to the English phrasing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Artıq {{productName}}-ə malik olan hesabları olan istifadəçiləri idxal etsəniz...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'входирате' (vhodirate) is an uncommon and slightly awkward way to say 'import' in this context. A more natural translation would be 'вносите' (vnosite).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Вносите

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'лиценз за {{productName}}' is slightly unnatural. It would be better to say 'лиценз за използване на {{productName}}' or simply 'лиценз на {{productName}}'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: лиценз на {{productName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'already existing accounts' is translated as 'již existujících účtů'. While technically correct, a more natural Czech phrasing would be 'existujících účtů' or 'dříve vytvořených účtů'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: existujících účtů

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'they will not be counted again in the counter' is translated as 'nebudou do počítadla znovu započítáni'. A more natural phrasing would be 'nebudou započítáni znovu'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: nebudou započítáni znovu

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'uusistä' is a spelling error. It should be 'uusista'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: uusista

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Le compteur de la limite autorisée" is a bit clunky. A more natural translation of "The license limit counter" would be something like "Le nombre maximal de licences".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Le nombre maximal de licences inclut:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Lors de l'importation, le compteur ne prend pas en compte" is not the best translation of "If you import users who already have a...account". It's a bit too literal. A more natural way to phrase it would be "Si vous importez des utilisateurs qui ont déjà un..."
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Si vous importez des utilisateurs qui ont déjà un...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "Votre licence {{productName}} vous permet..." sounds a bit formal and less conversational. A more accessible phrasing would be "Votre licence permet d'avoir..."
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Votre licence permet d'avoir...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ձեր {{productName}} լիցենզիան թույլ է տալիս ունենալ առավելագույնը {{maxLimit}} օգտվող:" is a literal translation and sounds unnatural in Armenian. A more natural phrasing would be something like "Ձեր {{productName}} լիցենզիան թույլ է տալիս ունենալ մինչև {{maxLimit}} օգտվող:" or "Ձեր {{productName}} լիցենզիան ունի {{maxLimit}} օգտվողի թույլտվություն:"
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ձեր {{productName}} լիցենզիան թույլ է տալիս ունենալ մինչև {{maxLimit}} օգտվող:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "che si desidera importare" is a bit formal and awkward. A more natural phrasing would be "che vuoi importare".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: che vuoi importare

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence "Se importi utenti che già dispongono di un account {{productName}}, questi non verranno contati nuovamente nel contatore" can be slightly improved for clarity and flow.  'Questi' refers to 'utenti', and making it clearer improves readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Se importi utenti che già dispongono di un account {{productName}}, questi ultimi non verranno contati nuovamente nel contatore.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'consists of' is too literal and clunky in Japanese. A more natural phrasing would be to describe what the counter represents.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ライセンス制限カウンターは、{{productName}}に既に存在するアカウントと、インポートする新規ユーザーの数に基づきます。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'カウントされません' (won't be counted) could be improved for clarity. It's understandable but a more user-friendly phrasing exists.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 既に{{productName}}アカウントを持っているユーザーをインポートしても、そのユーザーのライセンスは重複してカウントされません。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase '最大{{maxLimit}}人のユーザーを持つことができます' is grammatically correct but sounds somewhat formal and less friendly for a user interface. A more conversational tone is preferable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 現在の{{productName}}ライセンスで、{{maxLimit}}人までのユーザーを利用できます。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "가져오기하려는" is awkward. A more natural phrasing would be something like "가져오려는" or "새로 추가하려는".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 라이센스 제한 카운터는 {{productName}}의 기존 계정과 새로 추가하려는 새 사용자로 구성됩니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "해당 사용자는" is a bit stiff. It's better to simplify it for clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 이미 {{productName}} 계정이 있는 사용자를 가져오면, 카운터에 다시 계산되지 않습니다.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ພວກເຂົາຈະບໍ່ຖືກນັບອີກເທື່ອຫນຶ່ງຢູ່ໃນເຄົາເຕີ' is somewhat awkward.  'ເຄົາເຕີ' (counter) might not be the most natural word choice. It sounds overly technical.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ພວກເຂົາຈະບໍ່ຖືກນັບເຂົ້າໃສ່ອີກໃນຈຳນວນໃບອະນຸຍາດ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of '{{productName}}' appears consistent, but ensure this variable is properly handled in the translation pipeline to insert the correct product name.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: N/A - Confirm variable handling in pipeline.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ໃບອະນຸຍາດ {{productName}} ຂອງທ່ານ' could be slightly more natural. While technically correct, it sounds a little clunky.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ໃບອະນຸຍາດຂອງທ່ານ ສຳລັບ {{productName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Licenču ierobežojumu skaitītājs sastāv no:' is a bit clunky. The English uses a more conversational tone.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Licenču ierobežojumu skaitītājs ietver:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English says 'already existing accounts', while the translation says 'jau esošiem kontiem'. While accurate, 'jau esošiem kontiem' sounds a bit formal and rigid. A more natural phrasing might be preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: esošiem kontiem

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Repetition of '{{productName}}' and 'lietotājiem' is slightly awkward. Consider slight rephrasing for better flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jūsu {{productName}} licence ļauj jums uzņemt ne vairāk kā {{maxLimit}} lietotāju.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Polish translation uses a comma (,) to separate items in a list where a conjunction ('i') might be more natural. While grammatically correct, it sounds slightly less fluent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Licznik limitu licencji składa się z: kont istniejących już w {{productName}} i nowych użytkowników, których chcesz zaimportować.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'nie zostaną oni ponownie uwzględnieni na liczniku' is somewhat verbose and could be more concise. It literally translates to 'they will not be considered again on the counter'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Jeśli zaimportujesz użytkowników, którzy mają już konto {{productName}}, nie zostaną oni policzeni ponownie.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Portuguese translation includes "{{productName}}" multiple times, which should be consistent with the English original and potentially have proper localization applied based on context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review and ensure "{{productName}}" is consistently and correctly localized (e.g., translated or replaced with the product name in Portuguese).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Sua licença {{productName}}" is a bit awkward. It directly translates to "Your license {{productName}}" which isn't natural in Portuguese. It seems to be implying that the license *is* the product name, which isn't the intended meaning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing to something like "Sua licença para o {{productName}}" or "Sua licença do {{productName}}" to clarify that the license is *for* the product.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'The license limit counter' is translated as 'O contador de limite de licenças'. While technically correct, a more natural and commonly used phrasing would be 'O limite de licenças'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: O limite de licenças

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'already existing accounts' is translated as 'contas já existentes'. While understandable, 'contas existentes' is more common and reads better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: contas existentes

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'în spațiu {{productName}}' is awkward and doesn't accurately reflect 'in {{productName}}'. It implies a separate space or environment.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: în {{productName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'vor fi înregistrate de contorul din nou' is grammatically incorrect and doesn't accurately translate 'will not be counted again in the counter'.  'Înregistrate' means 'registered,' not 'counted'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: vor fi numărați din nou în contor

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Numărul maxim de {{maxLimit}} utilizatori este permis conform licenței dvs {{productName}}' is convoluted and doesn't flow well. The Romanian rephrasing of 'Your {{productName}} license allows you to have a maximum of {{maxLimit}} users' is less clear.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Licența dvs. {{productName}} vă permite să aveți maximum {{maxLimit}} utilizatori.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "බලපත්‍රයේ සීමාව ගණනය වන්නේ" is a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would be something like "බලපත්‍රයේ සීමාව තීරණය වන්නේ" or "බලපත්‍රයේ සීමාව වන්නේ".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: බලපත්‍රයේ සීමාව වන්නේ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ගිණුම්' (ginuum) is correctly used to refer to accounts, but the sentence structure can be improved for better readability. "{{productName}} හි දැනටමත් පවතින ගිණුම් සහ ඔබට ආයාත කිරීමට වුවමනා නව පරිශ්‍රීලකයින් අනුව වේ" can be restructured.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබට {{productName}} හි දැනටමත් පවතින ගිණුම් සහ ආයාත කිරීමට අවශ්‍ය පරිශ්‍රීලකයින් යන දෙදෙනාම සිටිති.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ඔබගේ {{productName}} බලපත්‍රය සඳහා උපරිම පරිශ්‍රීලකයින් {{maxLimit}} ක් ලද හැකිය." could be more naturally phrased. "ඔබගේ {{productName}} බලපත්‍රයෙන් {{maxLimit}} පරිශ්‍රීලකයින් දක්වා සිටීමට හැකියාව ලැබේ" is a better fit.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ඔබගේ {{productName}} බලපත්‍රයෙන් {{maxLimit}} පරිශ්‍රීලකයින් දක්වා සිටීමට හැකියාව ලැබේ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'The license limit counter consists of:' translates awkwardly as 'Obmedzenie licencie sa počíta takto:'. A more natural translation would be something like 'Počet povolených licencií sa určuje takto:' or 'Limit licencie sa vypočítava nasledovne:'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Počet povolených licencií sa určuje takto:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'they will not be counted again in the counter' translates as 'nebudú sa započítavať'. While technically correct, it's slightly wordy. A more concise translation would improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: nebudú započítaní.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Vaša licenca {{productName}} vam omogoča..." sounds slightly awkward in Slovenian. It's more natural to say something like "Vaša licenca za {{productName}} vam omogoča..." or "Vaša licenca {{productName}} omogoča..."
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vaša licenca za {{productName}} vam omogoča...

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of '{{productName}}' might feel clunky. Consider if there's a better way to integrate variable names in Slovenian, or if they should be consistent with English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the styling of the variable names and ensure consistency.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: Inconsistent use of dashes. The English uses a dash for the product name but the Serbian translation uses a hyphen. Although technically acceptable, consistency is preferred. This may be a subtle aesthetic concern.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a hyphen (-) throughout the Serbian translation when referring to the product name, mirroring the English version. For example, change '{{productName}}-у' to '{{productName}}–у'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The hyphen in "{{productName}}-u" appears multiple times. While grammatically correct in Serbian, it might be better to review consistency and consider if it's the best stylistic choice for a user interface.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review hyphen usage consistency. Consider alternatives like "{{productName}}u" or rephrasing for clarity.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'Vaša {{productName}} licenca vam dozvoljava da imate' is a bit verbose. A more concise and natural translation could improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Vaša {{productName}} licenca omogućava vam da imate' or 'Vaša {{productName}} licenca dozvoljava vam da imate maksimalno'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'içe aktarmak istediğiniz' is slightly awkward and could be more concise. While technically correct, it doesn't flow as naturally as a more direct phrasing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: içe aktaracağınız

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'already existing accounts' is translated as 'zaten var olan hesaplar'. A more natural Turkish phrasing would emphasize the accounts already in the system.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: zaten sisteminizdeki hesaplar

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "Số lượng giới hạn bản quyền" is a literal translation of "license limit counter" but sounds awkward in Vietnamese. A more natural phrasing would be something like "Giới hạn số lượng bản quyền" or "Số lượng bản quyền tối đa".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Giới hạn số lượng bản quyền

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "người dùng mới mà bạn muốn nhập" is a bit clunky.  A smoother way to express this would be to remove 'mà bạn muốn' as the action of importing is already implied.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: người dùng mới bạn muốn nhập

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "họ sẽ không được tính lại trong số lượng" is verbose and could be simplified.  "họ sẽ không được tính lặp lại" is more concise and clear.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: họ sẽ không được tính lặp lại

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "already existing accounts" is translated as "已存在的帐户". While technically correct, a more natural and common translation for this context would be "已注册账户" or "已有账户".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 许可证限制计数器包括：{{productName}}中**已注册账户**和您要导入的新用户。

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The placement of the period after "用户" in the first sentence feels slightly unnatural in Chinese. It's preferable to flow the sentence a little more smoothly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 许可证限制计数器包括：{{productName}}中已存在的帐户和您要导入的新用户**，**。
